The banner grab on port 22 returned "SSH-2.0-Go" but the command took too long to complete before I could read full details.

"SSH-2.0-Go" suggests this is an SSH server implemented in Go language, possibly a custom or lightweight SSH server.

timeout 2 bash -c "echo | nc 172.11.0.3 22"

This should try to grab initial banner with a short timeout.

If that is consistent and confirms the server is a Go SSH implementation, I will research known vulnerabilities or default credentials patterns to test.

The banner confirms the SSH server is "SSH-2.0-Go". This is often indicative of ssh servers implemented by the Go SSH package, for example "Golang.org/x/crypto/ssh" based servers or variants like "gatekeeper".

Next, I will check if the server allows SSH password authentication or only public key.
